dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think infrastructure is just roads and bridges, but actually Biden's new plan is a massive $2.1 trillion overhaul with huge investments in clean energy and caregiving.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think infrastructure is just roads and bridges, but actually Biden's new plan is a massive two point one dollars trillion overhaul with huge investments in clean energy and caregiving.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The $2 trillion Biden will ask Congress to approve for his American Jobs Plan will be spent over a period of eight years and paid for with tax hikes over a period of 15 years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's not just the scale—it's the timeline. This thing is spread out over eight years of spending, but they're planning to pay for it with tax hikes over 14 years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's not just the scale-it's the timeline. This thing is spread out over eight years of spending, but they're planning to pay for it with tax hikes over fourteen years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The $2 trillion Biden will ask Congress to approve for his American Jobs Plan will be spent over a period of eight years and paid for with tax hikes over a period of 15 years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and one of the big ticket items is $175 billion just for the electric vehicle market, which is part of that $625 billion transportation chunk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and one of the big ticket items is one hundred seventy five dollars billion just for the electric vehicle market, which is part of that six hundred twenty five dollars billion transportation chunk.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Included in that $2 trillion is $621 billion for transportation infrastructure like roads and bridges, with $174 billion of that set aside for the electric vehicle market, $111 billion for clean drinking water, $100 billion for expanding broadband and $100 billion for power infrastructure like the electric grid.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's all this money for things you wouldn't necessarily think of as traditional infrastructure, like $410 billion for the care economy—that's home health aides, child care, stuff like that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's all this money for things you wouldn't necessarily think of as traditional infrastructure, like four hundred ten dollars billion for the care economy-that's home health aides, child care, stuff like that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Theres also $213 billion for affordable and sustainable housing, $400 billion for the care economy and $100 billion for workforce development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But uh, paying for it means raising the corporate tax rate from 22% to 27%, which is definitely gonna face pushback.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But uh, paying for it means raising the corporate tax rate from twenty two percent to twenty seven percent, which is definitely gonna face pushback.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To help pay for all that spending, the Biden administration is expected to propose a series of major tax changes including raising the corporate rate from 21% to 28% and raising the global minimum tax.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh for sure. Republicans are already signaling they're not on board, especially with rolling back Trump-era tax cuts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh for sure. Republicans are already signaling they're not on board, especially with rolling back Trump-era tax cuts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While Republicans are sure to balk at the price tag and the potential repeal of many of President Trumps tax cuts for big companies and wealthy individuals to pay for the plan, some progressives are saying the package should be larger.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And even some progressives like AOC are saying it's not enough—she tweeted that it should be larger.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And even some progressives like A O C are saying it's not enough-she tweeted that it should be larger.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is not nearly enough, Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez tweeted Tuesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is interesting because this comes right after the $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan. So we're talking about trillions poured into recovery back-to-back.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is interesting because this comes right after the one point nine dollars trillion American Rescue Plan. So we're talking about trillions poured into recovery back-to-back.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The American Jobs plan follows the $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan, which Biden signed into law earlier this month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they might use budget reconciliation again to pass it, since that's how they got the Rescue Plan through without Republican support.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they might use budget reconciliation again to pass it, since that's how they got the Rescue Plan through without Republican support.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The American Rescue Plan was passed by Democrats over the objections of the Republican party using a special legislative process called budget reconciliation. Its not yet clear whether Democrats will attempt to use reconciliation for the infrastructure package or whether they will seek enough Republican votes to pass the bill using the standard process.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Plus there's this whole angle about domestic manufacturing—making it more expensive for companies to produce stuff overseas.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus there's this whole angle about domestic manufacturing-making it more expensive for companies to produce stuff overseas.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden also wants to encourage domestic manufacturing by making it more expensive for American companies to produce goods and services overseas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which analysts say could really benefit semiconductor manufacturers, since chips are in everything now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which analysts say could really benefit semiconductor manufacturers, since chips are in everything now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Analysts from Bank of America predict that companies that manufacture the equipment used to make semiconductorsthe computer chips found in everything from cars to smartphonesare poised to profit from Bidens push to modernize the United States digital infrastructure and shore up domestic production of the essential computer components as part of his $2 trillion plan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And apparently there's a part two coming next month focused on healthcare and childcare. So this is really just the opening act.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And apparently there's a part two coming next month focused on healthcare and childcare. So this is really just the opening act.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden is expected to introduce the second part of his American Jobs Plan next month. That proposal will include provisions related to healthcare and childcare.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild—this isn't your grandpa's infrastructure bill. It's like a total economic vision packaged as infrastructure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild-this isn't your grandpa's infrastructure bill. It's like a total economic vision packaged as infrastructure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And whether it passes as proposed or gets chopped up, it's gonna shape policy debates for years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And whether it passes as proposed or gets chopped up, it's gonna shape policy debates for years.

artist_script:
HostA: People think infrastructure is just roads and bridges, but actually Biden's new plan is a massive $2.1 trillion overhaul with huge investments in clean energy and caregiving.
HostB: Yeah, and it's not just the scale—it’s the timeline. This thing is spread out over eight years of spending, but they're planning to pay for it with tax hikes over 14 years.
HostA: Right, and one of the big ticket items is $175 billion just for the electric vehicle market, which is part of that $625 billion transportation chunk.
HostB: And then there’s all this money for things you wouldn’t necessarily think of as traditional infrastructure, like $410 billion for the care economy—that’s home health aides, child care, stuff like that.
HostA: Exactly. But uh, paying for it means raising the corporate tax rate from 22% to 27%, which is definitely gonna face pushback.
HostB: Oh for sure. Republicans are already signaling they’re not on board, especially with rolling back Trump-era tax cuts.
HostA: And even some progressives like AOC are saying it’s not enough—she tweeted that it should be larger.
HostB: Which is interesting because this comes right after the $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan. So we’re talking about trillions poured into recovery back-to-back.
HostA: And they might use budget reconciliation again to pass it, since that’s how they got the Rescue Plan through without Republican support.
HostB: Plus there’s this whole angle about domestic manufacturing—making it more expensive for companies to produce stuff overseas.
HostA: Which analysts say could really benefit semiconductor manufacturers, since chips are in everything now.
HostB: And apparently there’s a part two coming next month focused on healthcare and childcare. So this is really just the opening act.
HostA: It’s wild—this isn’t your grandpa’s infrastructure bill. It’s like a total economic vision packaged as infrastructure.
HostB: Absolutely. And whether it passes as proposed or gets chopped up, it’s gonna shape policy debates for years.
